newsitem.title: ITALY: S&P sees no rate change for Ambroveneto, Cariplo.
newsitem.headline: S&P sees no rate change for Ambroveneto, Cariplo.

text.p: Rating agency Standard & Poor's said it did not foresee modifications to credit ratings of Italy's Banco Ambrosiano Veneto and Cassa di Risparmio dell Provincie Lombarde (Cariplo) following a merger.
The foundation which controls Cariplo voted at the start of the week to start merger talks with Ambroveneto.
S&P said the two banks had ratings of A/stable/A-1, but did not indicate which ratings applied to which types of credit.

"Nevertheless, before taking any decision relative to the rating, and on condition that the transaction is finalised, Standard & Poor's will examine the financial aspects and the impact on the capital adequacy of the new group," S&P said in a statement.

It added: "Standard & Poor's considers that the complementary nature of the two banks in terms of branch location, activities and client base will ensure the new group will have strong cover in the private client market and in the market for small and medium sized companies in Italy."
